boardgame.name: Allies Enhanced
Allies Enhanced: Options for Followers, Friends, and other Henchmen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Allies Enhanced is a toolbox supplement for players to build and advance those Enhanced Extras that they dream up as part of their backstory or friends they've made along the way.

Within you will find:


Echelons to determine the starting ability of an ally from Incompetent to Handy,
Resolve a system to determine morale,
New Edges, including a new category for specific for Extras as well as Edges their Wild Card,
Modified Core Edges and how they work upon Extras explicitly including reworking of the Beast Bond and Beast Master Edges. Also a few new Hindrances for minions (and one for their leaders),
6 New Setting Rules as levers to affect these Enhanced Extras.

boardgame.name: Martial Options
Martial Options – Edges for Combat and Beyond
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Martial Options is 3 pages choke full of edges to enhance some of the lesser used Situational Rules. Contained within are:


18 New Edges (15 Combat, 2 Professional, and 1 Weird)
7 Additions to existing Combat Edges from the Core Rules to make them more competitive.

boardgame.name: Settingless
Settingless - 13ish Setting Rules without a Setting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Settingless is a set of Settling Rules to use for your Savage Worlds games, mix and match as you wish. Beware side effects are mayhem for GMs and players alike, excitement at your table, and the urge to play more!

Within these 4 short pages are 13 Setting Rules, with variations the count is closer double that (24 in total). Setting Rules such as Better, Faster, Smarter, Stronger; Follow Me!; and Run Away! are new rules. Some are alterations, variants, or expansions on existing rules like Die Hard; Expanded Conviction; and Higher Adventure. Unlock new character potential with rules like Background Threads; Chosen; Fated; High Magic; or Wild Talents. Rounding out are All for One and Common Sense rules for different play styles.

boardgame.name: Settingless 2
Settingless 2: 8ish Additional Setting Rules Strike Back
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Settingless 2: Setting Rules Strike Back is a set of Settling Rules to use for your Savage Worlds games, mix and match as you wish. Beware side effects are even more mayhem for GMs and players alike, loads of excitement at your table, and the urge to play so much more!

Within these 3 short pages are 8 more Setting Rules, with variations the count is actually double that (16 in total). Setting Rules such as Brain Power; Expanded Ranks; Quick Study and Slow and Steady are new rules to unlock new character potential. While Going for Speed; Grim Healing; Heroic Health and Reaction Time rules for different play styles.

boardgame.name: Settingless 3
Settingless 3: 8ish Arcane Setting Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Settingless 3: Arcane Setting Rules is a set of Settling Rules to use for your Savage Worlds games, mix and match as you wish. Beware side effects are more powerful mayhem for GMs and players alike, loads of magical excitement at your table, and a surge to play more!

Within these 3 short pages are 8 more Setting Rules all focusing on Arcane Backgrounds, with variations the count is more than doubled (17 in total). Setting Rules such as Apprentice Training; Late Bloomer and Power Seeks the Powerful are new rules to unlock new character potential. Also there are Alternate Replenishment; Arcane Spell Failure; Disrupting Powers; Force of Will and Multiple Power Maintenance rules for different play styles.

boardgame.name: Setting Rule: Veritas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most humans see the world through a distorting lens, a veil that hides that which would break their primate minds. Some seek to pierce the veil, to adjust for the distortion, to truly see the world for what it is. And some unfortunate few cannot avoid seeing the truth, no matter how much they would like to avoid doing so.

A Truth – Veritas – about how the world really works that may set them free, destroy them, or lead them to power. But a truth that also does not care - or even perceive - that humans exist.

Setting Rule: Veritas is a 4-page supplement intended for games that feature an uncaring universe, where ignorance is bliss and the truth gradually drives one insane. Powerful. But insane.
It provides a new Trait, an Edge, several setting rules and a couple of bare-bones campaign ideas spread over four pages:
1) Introduction (quarter-page or so)
2) A fairly fast ritual-like magic system (half-page or so) (Actually, a Dramatic Task implementation of the regular SWADE Powers magic system)
3) A 'Trait-like' (like Wealth) describing how much you understand the 'actual truth' of how the world works (think Cthulhu Mythos/the Veil of Kult, etc) that gives power and takes sanity (i.e. gives AB: Veritas and Power Edges along with mental hindrances.) (a page or so)
4) Notes on researching Veritas (through Tomes of lore) and acquiring new spells. (about a page)
5) How non-players (creatures, objects etc) interact with the above. (half-page)
6) A brief discussion of other campaign types this might be used in. (last page)

boardgame.name: Herbal Alchemy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laeressa had gathered the necessary materials for her sacred bag of protection and was at last able to create it. Settling into her alchemy lab, she placed the plants, flowers, and ground-up bones into her mortar and entered a meditative state as she mixed them together. With the protection of this herbal amulet, she would stand a much better chance of surpassing the thorny branches and dangerous creatures of the Dark Forest. The wisdom of the ancients and the forces of nature guided her.

Herbal Alchemy is a new Arcane Background that empowers characters to create magical concoctions such as potions, poultices, medicinal foods, and adhesives using natural components. Herbal alchemists are uniquely able to harness the inherent arcane properties in the flora and fauna of their environment. With an additional new Power Edge, Herbal Mastery, these alchemists can infuse even greater strength into their brews.

boardgame.name: Junkyard Arsenal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This small supplement is aimed at adding more flavor and options to almost any gear-starved setting, be it a gritty guerilla war, criminal faction feuds, barren post-apocalyptic wastelands or an untamed space frontier.

Inside you'll find:

A system for crafting DIY firearms with appropriate quirks and shticks.
Two Professional Edges to improve your heroes' gunmaking expertise.
27 scrappy and unorthodox weapons to arm your party and their foes.

boardgame.name: The Calensville Caverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Calensville Caverns is a location (with the addition several creatures who have called the caverns home) intended to be dropped in to the campaign setting of your choice. While written with a Post-Apocalyptic setting in mind, the descriptions of the various caves and creatures can be easily adapted to the setting of your choice from Fantasy to Sci-Fi.

For centuries, mankind has utilized the natural shelters of caves for places to live. As time went on, people moved out of this underground environment and into shelters on the surface that had been built with their own hands.

As time passed, mankind began to see these caves as places of wonder and adventure. Exploring them meant seeing things people had not seen in a long time, enjoying the beauty of nature, or sometimes even getting trapped and having to find a way out that no one has found before.

Caverns are places that inspire all sorts of emotions ranging from joy to fear. When an extraordinary event occurs and leaves civilization devastated, mankind ends up coming full circle and using caves the way they had in the beginning. Caves become shelter, meeting places, homes, and more a part of everyday life.

Sometimes however, they still hold mystery and adventure…

boardgame.name: Modern Traps and Obstacles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A common problem in modern games is a group of players deciding to break into a facility when there was absolutely no reason for the GM to prepare a facility in the first place. Luckily, Savage Worlds provides a great mechanic to improvise such a break-in at short notice, the Dramatic Task. Modern Traps and Obstacles provides an easy-to-use addition to the Dramatic Task system, supporting the GM with a simple way to generate traps, obstacles, and opposition, and thus making the narrative more sophisticated and fun! It also includes fast optional rules for a Legwork Phase, allowing the heroes to prepare for the break-in if time permits.

This product requires a copy of Savage Worlds Adventure Edition to use.

boardgame.name: 18Korea
boardgame.description:
18Korea is an online multiplayer game for 2 to 5 players (or 1 to 5 with AI) motivated by the beloved board game series '18xx'. In the 19~20 century Korean Peninsula, Make the best profit by running railroad companies and trading stocks.

[From Steam listing]

boardgame.name: Kyodaina Part 2
boardgame.description:
From Patreon:

Your exploration of Kyodaina continues with this content pack that introduces the unique way that exploration works in Kyodaina and your new Kyodaina Encounter tables, so you can begin your adventures!

boardgame.name: Sheep Leap
boardgame.description:
Somewhere in Ireland there is meadow with grazing sheep and a shepherd to take care of them.
Everything is peaceful...
...and so boring until the sheep start to jump over the fences.
Can you skip over all four fences before the shepherd catches one of the sheep or you run out of clovers?

Sheep Leap is a puzzle-ly solitaire in-hand game with only 17 cards. You can either use a regular card deck or the provided cards.

The game comes with 6 one-card expansions that you can mix and match to make it even more brain twisting.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bot Hunters
boardgame.description:
Each bot is precious to a young Bot Hunter, who wants to get a good name among peers and to prove to be the best. Wild bots can be found everywhere and to catch them a hunter needs to fight them. To catch bots also means to gain their trust and their valuable help in completing your mission. Unfortunately, you will frequently meet other mysterious masked hunters, who won’t mind getting in the way and you will have to fight.

To catch bots, to use their powers to catch other bots, to defeat all masked hunters, and to create winning combinations to gather Victory Points. The game takes from 7 to 9 rounds. At the end of the game, players count their Victory Points: Victory points obtained from their bots ($), from combinations of bots, and from other bonuses received during the game. The player with the highest number of Victory Points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Action Pack
boardgame.description:
Taktische Gefechte in Raumschiffen und Gebäuden

Der erste Traveller-ActionPack versetzt jeden Spieler in die Lage, taktische Gefechte an Bord von Raumschiffen oder im Inneren von Gebäuden abzuwickeln. Das erweiterte Kampfsystem aus TRAVELLER II - Söldner, Scouts und Handelsprinzen ermöglicht dies in leicht verständlicher, aber sehr realistischer Form.

boardgame.name: Unmatched: Jurassic Park – Dr. Sattler vs. T. Rex: Ian Malcolm miniature
boardgame.description: Upgrade Ian Malcolm from token to miniature
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Unmatched: Jurassic Park – Dr. Sattler vs. T. Rex

boardgame.name: Micro Cosmos: New Worlds and Old Authorities
boardgame.description:
Micro Cosmos: New Worlds and Old Authorities is an expansion to Micro Cosmos. The box holds 2 modules that can be added to the base game as well as a unique solo campaign mode.

NEW WORLDS

The NEW WORLDS module introduces a new end game trigger and plays around with the scouting action and survivor cards more. You no longer have to wait for a planet of a proper type to be terraformed in order to settle a survivor on it. Your survivors can be sent to the titular New Worlds in order to gain points and benefits.

OLD AUTHORITIES

The OLD AUTHORITIES module introduces much more indirect interaction between players with the introduction of 3 Councils that players fight over. Whoever works hardest to appease a Council, receives a special ability they can use every turn. This module greatly encourages early terraforming which influences the gameplay in interesting ways.

The NEW WORLD and OLD AUTHORITIES modules can be added separately to the base game or played together for deeper gameplay.

SOLO CAMPAIGN
Dive into a multi chapter adventure and mark your progress in a dedicated campaign notepad. Each game of the campaign introduces some new twist, new challenge and with that new ways of going through the game.

You start your journey as a captain of a worn down ark and with each scenario you unlock upgrades and eventually new ships. A special card system determines the length of a scenario. The time it takes to complete is varied as are the tasks presented to you. Each completed task is worth experience points which allow you to perform upgrades on your ark. Each game session influences the campaign and shape of the galaxy. Your progress and game status is easily saved in a dedicated booklet which lets you come back and continue playing anytime you want.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Right or Racist
boardgame.description:
Right or Racist is the party card game that confirms and combats stereotypes based on data, studies, and general information. There are 500 cards included.

Stereotype Cards present the players with a statement asserting a stereotype. Players must determine if the statement is right (true) or racist (false). While Debate Cards are subjective statements that players will vote on to determine if it's right or racist - and unlike America, majority vote wins!

But be careful, too many wrong answers and you run the risk of being labelled:
a) a racist bigot who incorrectly believes in too many stereotypes OR
b) a sissy snowflake that cries racism when it doesn't apply.

boardgame.name: Dune: Imperium – Go7 Insert
boardgame.description:
The Go7 Gaming storage solution for Dune: Imperium + Rise of Ix expansion provides card, token, and tile storage across five (5) removable trays, four (4) player boards, and one (1) reserve card tray. The included player boards provide each player with a wonderfully functional solution to organize cards and tokens during game play. This solution stores the leader cards in the player boards.

This storage solution provides:

·four (4) player boards with a home for your leader card, deck, discards, hand cards, small cards, and tokens
·one (1) reserve card tray for use during play
·one (1) removable setup token tray
·one (1) removable player token tray
·one (1) removable play token tray
·one (1) removable small card tray that includes dividers and also provides storage for tech tiles
·one (1) removable large card tray that includes dividers

The lid closes flat with zero lift.

Given the rare possibility that you don’t own the Ix expansion, you will want to place several layers of the empty wood frames from this kit (sized for the space) on top of the player boards to stabilize the internal trays. If you own Ix, your Ix play boards will use this space.

Go7 Gaming's custom-designed, multi-layer player boards will bring joy to your games. The player boards are designed for use during play and offer an organized player experience with a spot for everything.

The multi-layer reserve card tray is not strictly necessary during play, but it adds that final touch of polish that will elevate your games to the next level.

boardgame.name: Intersection
boardgame.description:
Players take turns rolling dice and strategically parking (locking) at least one die or combination of dice to score, but don’t get too comfortable because once you park and score, you can risk that score and go for more! Risk versus reward, a little luck, and strategically choosing ways to overcome will ultimately determine how high you can go.

The goal of the game of Intersection is to accumulate the highest total game score. To score points, players must park dice, fix “Sad faces”, and overcome the “Slow”, all while avoiding the “Stop”.

Set includes: 6 game dice, 1 velvet storage bag, and 1 printed instruction book.

boardgame.name: FOURCAST
boardgame.description:
A weather-themed, pattern-making card game. Use strategy and manipulation to complete your pattern while foiling your opponents. Finish all four weather types to win.

Players use a combination of "plain" and "action" weather cards to manipulate the weather cards in front of them or other players. If they align all four cards to the same color/type, they win that weather type/color.

On your turn, you can choose one action: draw a new card, take the top card from the discard pile and place it, place a card from your hand, or use an action card (Tornado, Rainbow, Lightning, Wind) to perform a special action.

boardgame.name: The Dungeon Delver's Toolkit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Savage Worlds is a great system, but it’s not great for old-school dungeon delves.”

How many of you Savages have heard that before? How many of you have said it? Well, it simply isn’t true.

The Dungeon Delver’s Toolkit is a collection of simple Setting Rules that will help to lend an old school fantasy feel to your SWADE games.

Inside you’ll find:


A system of Breaks and Breathers designed for delvers to keep them moving through the long corridors of the most dangerous dungeon. The system will also feel very familiar to those coming into SWADE from some other very popular fantasy RPGs.



A system of Fancy Combat Maneuvers which allow more freedom of action in combat.



An easy to use Setting Rule called Arcane Fatigue to bring an old school feel to the magical Arcane Backgrounds. This includes a new Hindrance and a couple Edges.


Whether you use these ideas to convert players who enjoy the popular RPGs, or to just bring some ‘1st Edition’ feel to your Savage game table, you will find something useful for your next Savage fantasy game. Use one, some or all of these ideas, whatever suits your table the best.

It’s Savage Worlds, after all. You can do what you want.

boardgame.name: Tactical SWADE: Modern Gun Options
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tactical SWADE: Modern Gun Options expands your Savage Worlds action games with new accessories to satisfy shooters, and new rules to keep the action flowing!


Accessorize Your Weapon: Customizers can trick out their guns with red-dot sights, muzzle brakes, accessory rails, and more.
Ammo Up: Why settle for standard lead when you could have AP+P, depleted uranium, silenced rounds, or flechettes?
Do It All: Enjoy new rules for hearing shots (including silenced/suppressed ones), concealing firearms, acquiring (or making) fancy custom ammo, and more!


This is a must-have for anyone using Savage Worlds for modern action, whether your game is gritty and realistic or over-the-top cinematic. If you've got guns, Tactical SWADE has options for them!

boardgame.name: Summoner's Circle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mad cultists calling up tentacled horrors to holy priests praying for warrior angels to clockwork contraptions crafted by a mad scientist, the summon ally Power is found throughout just about every Savage Worlds setting. Using this book, you'll be able to make that power your own, customizing your allies to fit the concept you have in mind for what your hero calls to battle - or use one of the deadly rivals or monsters in this book to challenge your players!

Inside you will find...

A system for designing your own allies at each rank, allowing you to build your summoned allies the way you imagine them and make sure things are balanced.
A selection of new Edges and Hindrances (10 in total) related to conjuration and its practitioners.
36 sample creatures to summon across all Ranks, all created using the ally creation system, from the sneaky Scout to the ship-shattering Talosan Titan.
10 fleshed-out NPCs to use in your game that demonstrate the use of the mechanics and concepts found in this supplement, ranging from an elven ecoterrorist to a dinosaur-summoning, time-traveling big game hunter.

boardgame.name: Mint Works: Playmat
boardgame.description: This neoprene mat was originally available as an add-on during the KS campaign for Mint Mini.

boardgame.name: Vikings of the North
boardgame.description:
Times are troubled and the seas are full of enemy ships. Manning your fleet with strength, courage and knowledge. Get your ships ready for battle and head out to sea. Your goal is to conquer your opponent's land. Viking of the North is a different and strategic board game with tactical and fast duels. With three players, the Asa gods have a finger in the pie, which makes the battles extra exciting and unpredictable. Björn Andreas Bull-Hansen has conquered the world with his books. The game is inspired by the books in the Jomsviking series and takes you back to the Viking Age.

Start with the first player, can do the following three steps
in this order each turn:
A. Turn over a dice in his port
B. Build a ship
C. Move a ship

The game is over when one of the players can no longer move, attack or build a ship (less than 3 dice in its port).

During the game, players get points for:
• 1 point for each opponent ship that is sunk
• 1 point for each warrior placed in the opponent's port
• 2 points for each pawn placed in the opponent's port. (The special farmers instead give 5 points if they are placed on their corresponding symbol)
After the end of the game, players also get points for:
• 1 point for each ship moved to the opponent's half of the playing field
• 1 point for each dice left by the opponent in their own port.

The player with the highest score wins!

boardgame.name: Mint Mini: Playmat
boardgame.description: This neoprene mat was originally available as an add-on during the KS campaign for Mint Mini.

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters Deck: Underground (PF1)
boardgame.description:
Generate interesting and appropriate monsters for your tabletop RPG campaigns with the Wandering Monsters Deck: Underground expansion deck from Nord Games.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters Deck: Waterways (PF1)
boardgame.description:
The Wandering Monsters Deck: Waterways is the perfect accessory to randomly generate interesting and appropriate monsters to challenge your players and always keep things fun while playing top role playing games!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters Deck: Wilderlands (PF1)
boardgame.description:
The Wandering Monsters Deck: Wilderlands is the perfect accessory to randomly generate interesting and appropriate monsters in your tabletop RPG games and to challenge your players and keep things fun!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters Deck: Dungeon (PF1)
boardgame.description:
The Wandering Monsters Deck: Dungeon is the perfect accessory to randomly generate interesting and appropriate monsters in your tabletop RPG games. This deck is meant to challenge your players and always keep things fun!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Gear Damage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"You should learn to take better care of your gear, sir," the smith looked over Mason's sword and shield, which had seen better days.

Mason dropped a coin purse on the table with a heavy clink. "You keep your weapons pristine when fighting of a horde of orcs ready to raze this town to the ground."

"True enough," he continued shrugging. "If ya did, I suppose I'd be out of a job. I'll have these ready for you tomorrow morning."

--

Adventuring life is hard and character's are just as hard (or harder) on the equipment they take with them. This document gives a simple Setting Rule that allows for equipment to breakdown through use without bogging the game down with extra book keeping.

boardgame.name: Simple Encumbrance
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mason looked over the treasure hoarde his group uncovered after slaying the dragon, "Gods, how are we gonna get this back to sell it?"

"Never fear, mate," Nestor said, throwing an arm over his companion's shoulder, "we'll load you up real good. Anythin' that don't fit on you we might haul out of here and have 'Ol Bess carry. Looks awful heavy though. Don't know if me old knees can take it. Best you carry it out."

Mason scowled at his companions grin.

--

Simple Encumbrance shrinks down the book keeping for encumbrance from various pounds every piece of item weighs and instead focuses on an abstract unit encompasing weight and bulk to create an easy system to keep track of everything the character is carrying with them without bogging down the game.

boardgame.name: Det nappar med Mamma Mu och Kråkan
boardgame.description:
Mamma Mu and Kråkan have lost their adventure puzzles in the lake. Now all the pieces are lying and bouncing around in a mess. You have already received the first piece. But you need five more pieces from the same puzzle to win the game. Now it's time to fish right puzzle pieces from the lake. Each puzzle has 6 pieces.

The players in turn fish up a piece of the puzzle and place it in front of them. If it´s not fit the player's own puzzle, the player can still save the piece.

The winner is the player who has first placed the whole of his puzzle.

boardgame.name: Quick Grids
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As game masters, our players often go off-track and leave us in the awkward situation of having to improvise some hostile terrain: a dungeon, facility, or cyberspace system. While Savage Worlds provides easy tools for these situations – Quick Encounters and Dramatic Tasks – a game master or group may wish for a bit more mechanical involvement and detail. Quick Grids fills this gap with a fast system to emulate a full run through a multi-stage area.

QUICK GRIDS
The Quick Grids supplement can be used to easily emulate a dungeon delve, breaking into a secure research facility, burning through a corporation’s cyberspace system, or infiltrating a hostile space station. It provides a fast rule framework while leaving ample room for individual hero decisions and roleplay.

Heroes or groups work their way through a grid of cards, discovering obstacles as they delve deeper into the chosen location. Depending on their goals they may have to succeed a specific number of rolls, cross the grid, or find a specific card.

boardgame.name: Pole Arms Compendium
The Pole Arms Compendium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nothing justifies this product!

In my youth, RPGs typically had a large collection of different pole arms. To reintroduce this level of detail is probably completely against the spirit of a fast, fun, and furious game. However, if you are that one guy or gal who just happens to love them, here is the largest collection of pole arms for Savage Worlds, ready for you to use! Fast and furious is OK, but this is all about fun.

Note that while the nearly monomaniac focus on pole arms makes this product a bit "tongue in cheek", the 13 pole arms described in this product are actual historical weapons and the game statistics have been designed to mesh with existing equipment and can be used in a serious fantasy or historical game.

Depressing times like these deserve a bit of fun.

boardgame.name: Modern Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nothing Inside this book, you’ll find a collection of monsters derived from modern mythology, cryptozoology, and the terrors of everyday life.

From black-eyed kids to slimes from the stars, creepy dolls to mirror wraiths, the fifteen monsters contained in this book are given Savage Worlds stats, detailed descriptions, advice for using them in your games, paragraph-long plot hooks, and some variations on the monster if the default version doesn’t quite hit the tone you’re going for.

All monsters are fully illustrated with their own commissioned art.

boardgame.name: Komodo Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The apex predator of their home islands, Komodo dragons are frequently found in the menageries of pulp villains or threatening adventurers in jungle climes.

This file contains Savage Worlds Adventure Edition statistics for an adult Komodo dragon and 18 paper miniatures.

boardgame.name: Intermission: Downtime & Projects
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all game action has to be at the table! Intermission: Downtime and Projects presents a simple, fast, and fun way to track and work on long-term goals and projects in your Savage Worlds game. It allows you to set a goal and work toward it over the course of one or several periods of down time, including elements like...


A crafting system for creating mundane gear, temporary Power-granting objects called arcane contraptions, and permanent magical artifacts, all compatibile with both the core Powers system and the No Power Points setting rule.
Creating and maintaining contacts and connections of different strengths and types over the course of the campaign with a Favor Die mechanic based on the Wealth Die system.
Gathering rumors in between missions.
Planning and executing jobs like heists, with a flashback system to prevent hours of endless planning before you can get to the action.
Researching and learning new Powers, both existing and custom ones you create.

boardgame.name: Le Labyrinthe du Minotaure
boardgame.description: Be the first to get out of the labyrinth imagined by Daedalus while avoiding the Minotaur. This is a tile-laying strategy game. Roll the die then place your tiles, move or block your opponents. Be careful, if you meet the Minotaur in his lair, you will have to face him in a duel!

boardgame.name: Instant Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A very simple method of using cards to generate encounters in dungeon crawls, wilderness treks and the like. Just draw a card for each of the four kinds of dungeons described. It's easy to adjust to any genre and any party.

boardgame.name: How To: Skill Specialization
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Specializations Setting Rule in Savage Worlds tends to get a bad rap, but if it's applied properly and carefully, I think you can get a lot of mileage out of the rule. How To: Skill Specialization aims to place a spotlight on when to use the rule, the best ways to implement it, and how it interacts with Edges such as Jack-of-All-Trades or rules such as Familiarization.

This requires a copy of Savage Worlds Adventure Edition to use.

boardgame.name: Furious Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic in Savage Worlds depends on Power Points. The core book provides the alternative No Power Points Setting Rule, yet that still relies on the underlying structure of Power Point cost and makes upper Rank powers highly unreliable in use.

Furious Magic is built from the ground up to provide magic use with no reliance on or reference to Power Point cost. Basic spellcasting stays fast and reliable, while Power Modifiers bring difficulty and the potential of consequences for using more powerful magic. In Furious Magic, spellcasters can choose between easy casting of basic spells or risking higher chances of failure and Backlash for additional effects. In the same spirit, duration of powers works differently and becomes a conscious choice between short use of duration powers or the benefit of long-running powers at a price. This leads to an overall increase in power (pun intended) of arcane heroes and we highly recommend setting-specific limitations like restricted power and Power Modifier lists for each Arcane Background.

boardgame.name: Expanded Wealth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This small supplement gives players and GMs a more tangible way to interact with the new Wealth system introduced in Savage Worlds, with clear and simple modifiers for prices, improved Gambling rules when using Wealth, and even a Lifestyle system that can be easily used to track how your players are living within their world, and if they're trying to live within their means.

This product requires a copy of Savage Worlds Adventure Edition to use.

boardgame.name: Bloodsport Gambler
boardgame.description:
Bloodsport Gambler, a game for 1-2 players, focuses on a tense & seedy story of risk, luck, and the efforts that sway fate in your favor. The simple gameplay combines card-driven strategy, risk mitigation, and resource management with the thrill of betting, dice rolling, and pushing your luck.

Thrust into desperation by swelling debts, you must gamble on the foul pit fights of Ghoulmorrah in a last-ditch struggle to pay off a merciless syndicate of moneylenders. With looming payments fast approaching, the only way to beat the odds is to sleuth, scheme, and sabotage. While a sure bet is favorable to warding off debt collectors, the risk of getting caught cheating could rid you of your earnings, your reputation, or worse - your life! Only those who are clever and cunning enough to pay off their debts will survive the vile underbelly of the slithering city.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sleeper Cells
boardgame.description:
In Sleeper Cells players take turns drawing and playing cards to lead attacks against their opponent. The game ends when a player runs out of life. Outwit your opponent in a tactical duel where playing the strongest cards at the wrong time can be just as deadly for you as for your opponent.

Each turn consists of 3 actions. You may draw cards play, flip cards or attack with cards all with the intent of overwhelming your opponent and destroying them.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Savage Guide to Dinosaurs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking to introduce dinosaurs to your next Savage Worlds game? A Savage Guide to Dinosaurs features nineteen fully statted dinosaurs including classics like the Triceratops and the Tyrannosaurus Rex.

Also included is an original adventure titled Dino World!

"Dino World, once humanity’s greatest achievement, is now surrendered to the dinosaurs who once served as exhibits. But not everyone is satisfied with leaving dinosaurs behind. Eric Winslow, CEO of FTRE, wants a dinosaur and he’s willing to pay. The party has been hired to retrieve three eggs from the defunct Dino World theme park."

Pregenerated characters included!

boardgame.name: Trogdor!!: The Board Game – Expando Deck: Magicks and ‘Mergencies
boardgame.description:
Introducing the all new Majicks & ‘Mergencies Expando Deck for Trogdor!! The Board Game. Extend your cooperative burnination even further with all new cards and gameplay elements that give players more options, more interesting choices, and more chaotic burnination!

Communal Emergency Cards that can be used any time on anyone’s turn to get Trogdor out of some tight jams!
Spell Cards with mini side quests to complete that can bring Peasants back from the Void!
Brand new Action Cards to add more humorous variety to gameplay!

boardgame.name: The Con-Carnival mystery board game
boardgame.description:
There is a traveling carnival rumored to be a front for con artists & thieves... and one has just arrived in your town. Could it be the infamous “Con-Carnival“? By finding CLUEs and gathering points you must determine whether this carnival is the infamous CON-Carnival or just plain FUN. But you only have until 8:00!

DID YOU KNOW: The Con-Carnival is a fictional carnival that originates from The Spirit Seeds graphic novel series.

boardgame.name: A Beacon in the Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for Cepheus Engine.

For two hundred years the human settlers on Sarmahalos III have walked up the mountain overlooking their primary city and wondered at the alien spire at the top. No one knows who built it or why. But professor Xia Sokolov thinks that he knows the answers. And he offers to hire the travelers to do a little leg work to find out if he is correct.

boardgame.name: 60 Tavern Situations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is always something unsuspected going on in a tavern...

This product:

- contains 60 situations in total, which are split into 6 different locations (cellar, dining hall, kitchen, lobby, outside, rooms),

- has 3 black and white vector illustrations,

boardgame.name: Beyond the Sea of Falling Skies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the time of the Kin Wars many species headed east to find new lands and new hope. They would travel through the ancient forests lost to mortals for eons. They would sail beyond the Sea of Falling Skies to distant shores. Yet, they would inevitably find one unmistakable truth. That one can never run far enough to escape their own demons.

This expansion book for the Demon Gate system is filled with sixty new chi abilities and more rules for the martial arts. New weapons and armor designed in the far reaches of Myen Wu. A new map and classes like the mysterious ninja, or the fallen ronin. Play some of the new species such as the naga, the kitsune, and the oni. There are plenty of adventures to be had, just "keep the fires high."

boardgame.name: Junk Drawer
boardgame.description:
Players organize their junk drawer by carefully arranging various shaped items within the four sections. Each section has a unique organizational goal and each round, players must place one item in each section. At the end of the game, each section earns points based on how well they are organized. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Brew Crafters: Insert Here Insert
boardgame.description:
This storage solution is composed of six removable trays and accommodates premium sleeved cards.One tray holds the recipe tokens while another holds the cards. The other trays hold the other various tokens and pieces as pictured. The storage solution requires player boards to be stacked evenly as pictured.

- Description from publisher web site

boardgame.name: Passport To Culture: Travel Edition
boardgame.description:
In Passport to Culture players travel around the world map depicted on the game board, with the goal of filling their passport with stamps. Along the way players must attempt to answer questions pertaining to the diverse peoples and countries of the world.

The Travel Edition includes more than 1,000 new and unique questions, as well as a Cultural Intelligence (CQ) scoring key score pad and a reduction in player count.

Contents: Game comes with 203 country/ continent cards (with over 1,000 questions), 5 Passports, 50 magnetic passport stamps, custom Passport To Culture die, 15 answer cards, a score pad and instructions.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: Echoes of Abscalon
boardgame.description:
The Frozen Mountains - Discover the genesis of Anastyr and Abscalon on an adventure that will lead them to change the fate of Alboraan.

A new region: Majestic snow-capped mountains, deadly cold, and brutal clans with rites of madness.

Face the Ice Witch and her regal white dragon in an epic duel... but an even greater challenge awaits you!

Deal with nature's hostility and chilling weather while keeping you opponents from being overcome by a murderous rage.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: The Queen's Vow
boardgame.description:
The Necropolis of the Mad Kings - The Companions of the Spear face a new threat that could forever change the face of Alboraan.

A new region: a mysterious necropolis, the tomb of an ancient civilization and the kingdom of the necromancer Abscalon.

Legions of the living dead, wraiths of demented kings, and a fearsome amber hearted bone golem block our Heroes' way.

Halt the dead from rising once more by eliminating the source of their immortality.

boardgame.name: Birdie!: Golf Nano Game
boardgame.description:
Birdie! Golf Nano Game is a golf simulation game that uses an innovative mechanism of rolling the dice and modifying the results to maximize strategy and minimize the luck.

The objective of the game is to complete the 9 holes making the fewest possible shots.

In each turn you must choose your club well (number of dice), hit with the correct force (preset) and take into account the wind (condition). You should also be careful around the sandbanks and the water (hole hazards)...

The player with the best score at the end of hole 9 will win!

Designed for the 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

boardgame.name: Vandrouki: Америка
boardgame.description:
A board is a map of America (North America and South America). The goal of the travellers is to collect as many points as they can for visited countries. And this is not always about countries' quantity.

Each player is a traveller with the unique citizenship. In the beginning of a game a player gets citizenship (Russia, Belarus, Ukraine or Kazakhstan), 100 dollars and three bonus cards.

In a player's turn he can do one of the following actions:

to visit a new country by bus, by plane, by ship or


by hitchhiking. A player moves his meeple to new country on the board. In order to do it he needs to pay corresponding money (price for bus travel or plane travel) or roll a dice (using luck in hitchhiking).

to earn money by working in a player's current country.
to make Visa (USA Visa or Canada Visa). Without Visa it is impossible to visit some countries in the game.
to make international passport.


Also a player in his turn can play bonus cards.

For visiting new country a player gets a flag of the country and gets corresponding points; then he gets a bonus card.

A game ends when all countries are visited. A player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Railways of the World: "Ice" Player Color Trains and Mini-Expansions
boardgame.description:
Contains 1 set 25 transparent trains and 1 transparent set of 4 mini-expansions (a total of 16 pieces), as well as a light bluish-white wooden scoring marker for use as an alternative player color when playing Railways of the World or Railways of Nippon, or any of their expansions. These items have been included for free with the Kickstarter for Railways of Nippon (2016) and the Kickstarter for Railways of Australia, of Sweden, and Rail Barons of the World (2021).

The transparent mini-expansions are for use as Hotels, Switch Tracks, Fuel Depots and Mines, the rules for which were introduced in the Railways of the Western U.S. Expansion and Railways of North America Expansion for Railways of the World.

boardgame.name: The Mandalorian Trivia Quiz
boardgame.description: Mandalorian trivia quiz. 100 questions with two levels of difficulty.

boardgame.name: Speak Out: Not Famous Movie Quotes
boardgame.description:
Get friends together for some sidesplitting fun as players try to say different phrases while wearing a mouthpiece that won't let them shut their mouth. This expansion pack features phrases that sound a lot like famous movie quotes…but just "off" enough to challenge players and generate lots of laughs. Players draw from the deck and read the phrase as best as they can, but it's not so easy to do when the mouthpiece is hindering them from forming words correctly. Players try to say phrases such as "We need to walk about your weepy mess reports". Teammates must correctly guess the phrase in under a minute in order to earn the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game wins. The expansion pack can be added to the original Speak Out game or 1 player can use the mouthpiece and everyone else can guess what he or she is saying. (Timer not included in expansion pack.)

Contents: 144 Pieces of Content on 72 Double Sided Content Cards, 1 Washable Mouth Piece, Instructions.

boardgame.name: Farts & Fairies: Suprise Farty Expansion Deck
boardgame.description: Attack with fart cards. Seek revenge with surviva cards. Unleash the magic of fairy cards. And use strategy with action cards. At the end of the game the player with the least amount of farts is crowned the 'Survivor of the Fartest.'

boardgame.name: Farts & Fairies Playmat
boardgame.description: Neoprene play mat for Farts & Fairies.

boardgame.name: 时间互搏：假面骑士 (Chrono Clash System: Kamen Rider)
boardgame.description:
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go. Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!
Utilizing the universal Chrono Clash system, the universes and characters used will draw in players of card games, board games and each respective universe's fans alike!

The Chinese version Chrono Clash System has two series：Kamen Rider and LoveLive.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: 时间互搏：学园偶像计划（Chrono Clash System: LoveLive!）
时间互搏：学园偶像计划（Chrono Clash System: LoveLive!）

boardgame.name: Star Wars™ Pinball VR
boardgame.description:
For the first time ever, Star Wars™ Pinball surrounds us in virtual reality! Star Wars™ Pinball VR collects 8 AMAZING TABLES:
• The Mandalorian
• Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope
• Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back
• Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi
• Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
• Star Wars Rebels
• Masters of the Force
• Classic Collectibles
Exciting new features exclusive to this release:
• The fully customizable FAN CAVE houses your “virtual” pinball table and items you earn.
• TOTAL IMMERSION MODE allows you to experience everything at table level.
• 360-DEGREE MINIGAMES surround you with iconic Star Wars set pieces.
Other features from past Star Wars™ Pinball releases return:
• HAPTIC FEEDBACK for controllers so it feels like actual pinball
• CAREER MODE for short, targeted gameplay sessions
• FORCE POWERS to power up your play
• A CANTINA JUKEBOX of John Williams music

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Walkabout Mini Golf
boardgame.description:
“An adorable mini-golf game that is unexpectedly convincing” — New York Times

“Brilliantly designed... Seriously, you have no idea how good VR mini-golf is” — CNET

“Everyone with an Oculus Quest 2 needs to play Walkabout Mini Golf” — TechRadar

8 unique 18-hole courses to master
Unlock NIGHT MODE for more challenging versions of all courses
Play solo, 1v1 online quick match, or create a private room with up to 5 players
Extremely accurate physics feel just like the real thing
Collect over 188 custom balls hidden throughout
Solve treasure hunts on each hard course to earn special putters
Supports cross-buy, cross-play, and 90hz on Quest 2
Teleport and Smooth locomotion supported, as well as the ability to fly
Supports Oculus groups, invites and friend lists
Additional DLC courses available for purchase
UPDATED with driving range, practice green and more!
New avatars featuring lip sync, a quadrillion+ combinations
Supports English, French, Spanish, German, Japanese, Korean and Chinese

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Sheep 7
boardgame.description:
In Sheep 7, players take on the role of shepherds trying to round up their flocks of sheep as quickly as possible.
Your flock of sheep has scattered into small groups! As a good shepherd, you must regroup them! If you want to win, be the first to gather your flock!

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Northwind Tales
boardgame.description: In Sword & Sorcery Northwind Tales, the heroes will journey to a land plagued by cold winds and snow, face a fearsome Viking army led by a conqueror named Wotan, find Yggdrasil, the tree that supports the universe, and face the threat of Níðhöggr, the undead dragon. The Northwind Tales Challenge Set expansion allows players to modify the game difficulty and the overall game experience by combining the S&S Northwind Tales enemies with new variants of all rank-and-file Enemies.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sword & Sorcery: Northwind Tales – Challenge Set

listing.notes:
All items in the Legendary Hero Pledge
https://ks.aresgames.eu/product/sword-sorcery-ancient-chronicles-legendary-hero-pledge-second-wave/
Ancient Chronicles Core Set Northwind Tales Core Set Kickstarter Bonus Set Challenge Set
Payment by e-transfer. Local meet-up can be arranged.

boardgame.name: Dinosaurios en el mundo perdido
boardgame.description:
Up to four journalists - two men and two women - travel to a remote island in the Pacific Ocean to take pictures of dinosaurs.

At the beginning of the game, every player draws a number of cards featuring a picture and the name of the species they have to photograph, plus some info and a difficulty number.

A dice roll equal or great than this number means the picture was taken.

Players then roll and move across the island following paths trying to reach their dinosaur targets. In their journey they can fall in "roll again" and "lose your turn" squares, and there are "air transport" and "sea transport" too, and a bridge!

The winner is the first player to leave the island with all its photographs done.

boardgame.name: The Expiration of Barrington Peake
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
A promotional adventure for LotFP in the Weird Crusher series.

Publisher blurb:
No one has seen Barrington Peake for ages and now strange noises are coming from his town house!

boardgame.name: Strict Time Records Must Be Kept
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Dinner Date... with Death!

Staying with friends is supposed to be fun and relaxing, but what if that “friend” doses you with a slow-acting and fatal poison as part of a demented game for the perverse amusement of wealthy people?

That’s the problem the player-characters must solve, while trapped miles from help, surrounded by bastards, confounded by puzzles and traps, and with every minute bringing them closer to a horrible and messy demise.

Strict Time Records Must Be Kept is an adventure for Lamentations of The Flame Princess Weird Fantasy Roleplaying and other traditional role-playing games. For the most meaningful campaign, the adventure is recommended for characters of up to third level.

boardgame.name: Earth Incubation Crisis
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Hills Are Alive...With the Sound of Murder!

Missing kids! Rumors of witchcraft! Strange things skulking about the mountains and marshes under the cover of darkness!

Sounds pretty standard, right? Maybe, but this is Lamentations of the Flame Princess where this kind of stuff is merely a cover for the truly weird goings-on. Within the covers of this book is a mystery of titanic proportions that begins in the Cretaceous Period and might end in the destruction of Earth itself!
